title: Naruvi Hospital’s webinar on arthritis on April 27

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Blood flows on lush meadow as gunshots break afternoon calm

title: How a previous attempt in Tamil Nadu to study Centre-State relations panned out
content:
The DMK government, led by M.K. Stalin, has recently constituted a committee on the subject. Over 50 years ago, the report of the Rajamannar Committee, constituted by the M. 
Karunanidhi-led DMK government in September 1969, came out in May 1971 and ran into criticism from different parties, some of which are now allies of the DMK

title: Maharashtra government relents, Hindi no longer compulsory

title:
A modest menagerie to a sprawling refuge for wildlife — the story of 
Vandalur Zoo
content: In 1855, Edward Balfour, Director of the Government Central Museum in Madras, proposed a collection of live animals for public display on the museum premises. In 1861, the government relocated the animals to the People’s Park near Central Station. Limited space and pollution from the nearby industries forced the shift to Vandalur

title: EU’s far-right vs judiciary conflict

title: Mike Patrick, longtime ESPN broadcaster, dies

title: Sources: Arkansas' Fland to portal by deadline
content: Arkansas freshman Boogie Fland will enter the transfer portal ahead of the midnight deadline, sources told ESPN's Jeff Borzello. The former five-star prospect is focused on the draft, but is keeping his options open.

title: Isles won't renew Lamoriello's deal, seek new GM
content: Hockey Hall of Famer Lou Lamoriello, 82, is out as president and general manager of the New York Islanders, after the team said Tuesday the longtime executive's contract was not being renewed following a year in which the club failed to make the playoffs.

title: Ex-NBA ROY Carter-Williams to debut in boxing
content: Former NBA ROY Michael Carter-Williams will make his amateur boxing debut May 29 in New York, facing Sam Khativ in a three-round heavyweight bout.

content: Manchester United are exploring the possibility of triggering the release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract at Wolves, a source has told ESPN.

title: PM Modi Meets "Brother" Mohammed Bin Salman In Saudi, Key Agreements Signed
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah on Tuesday, where the two leaders held wide-ranging bilateral talks. Four key agreements were signed following the hours-long meeting between the two leaders.

title: "A Man Came And Shot My Husband": Tourists' Horror In Pahalgam
content: "Please save my husband," a woman's bone-chilling wails echoed through the picturesque valley of Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam after terrorists opened fire at tourists today.

title: 18-Year-Old UP Student Allegedly Shot Dead In School: Cops
content: An 18-year-old student died during treatment after allegedly being shot in a private school located here in Khushalnagar, a police official said.

title: PM Cuts Short Saudi Trip After J&K Attack, To Leave For India Tonight: Sources
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will cut short his Saudi Arabia trip and leave for India tonight, say government sources, after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam claimed 26 lives.

title: Navy Officer Among 26 Killed In Terror Attack In J&K's Pahalgam: Sources

title: Kashmir Terror Attack Updates: 26 Killed; National Conference, Mehbooba Mufti's PDP To Support Bandh Today

title: Why Pope Francis Named Himself After Italian Saint St Francis of Assisi
content: When Jorge Mario Bergoglio became pope in 2013, he chose a name no pontiff had ever taken: Francis. It was inspired by St Francis of Assisi - the saint of the poor, the humble and the earth.

content: President Donald Trump wants both the United States and India to grow and the two countries can work together across sectors including trade, defence and energy for a win-win partnership, US Vice President JD Vance said on Tuesday.

content: Israel on Tuesday said it was "deeply saddened" by the terror attack on tourists in Jammu & Kashmir, saying it stands united with India in the fight against terror.

content: Talks between the United States and China on a trade deal have made progress, the White House said Tuesday, despite Donald Trump's tariffs policy and Beijing's retaliatory measures.

title: J&K attack: Terrorists massacre 28 tourists in Pahalgam
content: In a shocking incident, 28 tourists were killed in a terrorist attack near Pahalgam, J&K, marking the deadliest such event since 2019. The Resistance Front, linked to LeT, claimed responsibility. The attack, coinciding with significant international visits and heightened tensions with Pakistan, evoked memories of past massacres.

title: People wail for help as loved ones lie in pools of blood: Pahalgam attack
content: Pahalgam in South Kashmir experienced a terror attack. Terrorists attacked a tourist spot in Baisaran Valley. The attack resulted in at least 20 injuries. Security forces and locals assisted in rescue operations. Authorities are investigating the incident. Top officials condemned the attack, and assured that the perpetrators will face consequences.

title: KL Rahul haunts old team as DC crush Rishabh Pant's LSG
content: Delhi Capitals secured a dominant eight-wicket victory against Lucknow Super Giants, propelled by KL Rahul's unbeaten 57 and Abishek Porel's explosive 51. Rahul reached a milestone, becoming the fastest Indian to 5000 IPL runs. Mukesh Kumar's impressive 4/34 restricted LSG to 159/6, setting the stage for DC's comfortable chase and solidifying their second position on the points table.

title: Trump dials PM Modi, assures 'full support to India in fight against terror'
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that claimed the lives of at least 26 people, mostly tourists, US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin strongly condemned the violence and assured India of their support in fighting terrorism.

title: Microsoft’s chief HR to managers: This isn't just about Microsoft's success...
content: Microsoft is implementing stricter performance management policies, including a two-year rehire ban for underperformers and restrictions on internal transfers. These changes aim to accelerate high performance and swiftly address low performance, aligning with industry trends toward performance-based evaluations. The company is also introducing AI-supported tools to aid managers in performance conversations.

title: KL Rahul's cryptic post after demolishing former team LSG
content: KL Rahul's unbeaten half-century powered Delhi Capitals to an eight-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Rahul, playing against his former team, reached the 5,000-run milestone in the IPL during his innings. Abishek Porel's aggressive knock of 51 also contributed significantly to Delhi's successful chase of 160, while Mukesh Kumar's four-wicket haul restricted Lucknow to a manageable total.

title: From Amarnath to Pahalgam: Major civilian terror strikes in J&K since 2000
content: On April 22, a terrorist attack in Anantnag district's Pahalgam area killed 26 people, including tourists and security personnel. The assault, which occurred near the Baisaran Valley, claimed the life of an Indian Navy officer and two foreign nationals. This incident is the latest in a series of attacks targeting civilians and security forces in Kashmir since 2000.

title: Trump Tariffs: Amazon CEO makes a 'promise', says that I understand why, I mean ...
content: Amidst escalating tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, Amazon is navigating challenges to shield consumers from rising costs. CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges the strain on businesses, anticipating price increases from third-party sellers. Amazon is strategically mitigating impact through bulk purchases and renegotiated contracts, while observing early signs of consumer stockpiling in response to expected price hikes.

title: Waqf law issue: AIMPLB accuses NDA constituents of ‘stabbing Muslims in the back’
content: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) has strongly criticized NDA allies for supporting the Waqf Amendment Act, accusing them of betraying the Muslim community. At a 'Save Waqf' conference in Delhi, AIMPLB demanded the law's withdrawal, warning of widespread opposition.

title: KL Rahul gets his redemption in Lucknow with massive IPL milestone
content: KL Rahul achieved a significant milestone, reaching 5000 IPL runs in a record 130 innings, as Delhi Capitals secured a dominant 8-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Rahul's unbeaten 57, along with Abishek Porel's fifty, guided DC to chase down the target of 160 with ease. Mukesh Kumar's impressive 4/33 helped restrict LSG to a below-par total.

title: In a first, Mehbooba, Mirwaiz call for J&K shutdown today
content: Following the terrorist attack on tourists in Pahalgam, PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti and Hurriyat leader Mirwaiz Umar Farooq have jointly called for a "Kashmir bandh" on Wednesday. Mehbooba urged Kashmiris to unite in solidarity, echoing the Jammu Chamber and Bar Association's shutdown call, to condemn the cowardly act of terror.

title: College baseball Week 10: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: we're getting down to crunch time for some teams to prove themselves . the biggest riser was Vanderbilt, which jumped up 10 spots after sweeping Georgia . Ole Miss dropped 12 spots to no. 23 in the ranking this week after losing a road series to south Carolina .

content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan CEO & others sold billions in stock before Trump Tariffs
content: Before President Trump's tariff announcement triggered a market crash, Meta's Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan Chase's Jamie Dimon, and Oracle's Safra Catz sold significant amounts of stock. These sales, totaling billions, occurred just before the market downturn, raising questions about potential insider knowledge. While the market plummeted, some billionaires saw it as a buying opportunity.

title: SC’s TN ruling doesn’t entirely cover Kerala government dispute: Centre
content: The Centre argued before the Supreme Court that its ruling in the Tamil Nadu governor's case doesn't fully resolve the legal dispute between Kerala and its governor. Kerala's counsel claimed the verdict addresses the issue of time limits for presidential reference. The Centre's representatives, however, asserted that certain aspects remain unaddressed and require further examination by the court.

title: 'Numb disbelief': Cricketers condemn Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir, which claimed 26 lives, Indian cricketers - past and present - Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir, Parthiv Patel, and Aakash Chopra condemned the violence. Gambhir asserted that those responsible would face consequences. Union Home Minister Amit Shah, along with Lt Governor Manoj Sinha, visited Srinagar to assess the situation and meet with officials and victims.

title: What is The Resistance Front? TRF claims responsibility for J&K attack
content: The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy for Lashkar-e-Taiba, claimed responsibility for the Pahalgam attack that killed 26 tourists. This banned group recruits youth online for terrorist activities and is supported by Pakistani intelligence. Following the deadly attack, Union Home Minister Amit Shah arrived in Srinagar to assess the security situation and will chair a high-level meeting with security officials.

title: Watch: KL Rahul hurries away as Sanjiv Goenka looks for handshake
content: KL Rahul marked his return to Ekana Cricket Stadium with an unbeaten half-century, guiding Delhi Capitals to a dominant 8-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. His composed innings, along with Abishek Porel's fifty, ensured a comfortable chase of 160. Mukesh Kumar's four-wicket haul earlier restricted Lucknow to a manageable total, setting the stage for Delhi's triumph.

title: Forced to climb down 30-foot well, women in this Nashik Village risk lives
content: Residents of Borichibari village in Nashik face a severe water crisis, forcing women to risk climbing down a well for water. Despite claims of water supply by the gram panchayat, villagers report otherwise. A viral video shows a woman descending into a well, prompting an official inspection.

title: 'I regret playing cricket': Former India captain drops bombshell
content: Mohammad Azharuddin has voiced his profound disappointment after the HCA Ombudsman ordered the removal of his name from the North Stand at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. He expressed feeling heartbroken and described the situation as a complete disgrace to the sport, further alleging corruption within the HCA led to him being barred from contesting elections.

title: Royals match-fixing allegation: Battle for IPL tickets takes centre-stage
content: Rajasthan Royals have strongly refuted match-fixing allegations made by Rajasthan Cricket Association ad-hoc committee convener Jaydeep Bihani, labelling them as baseless and defamatory. The franchise asserts that Bihani's claims undermine the team, the BCCI, and the integrity of cricket. A BCCI official dismissed the allegations, suggesting they stem from upcoming RCA elections.

title: UPSC Civil Services 2024: Pune's Archit Dongre achieves AIR 3
content: Archit Parag Dongre from Pune has achieved All India Rank 3 in the UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024, making him Maharashtra's top performer. The UPSC announced the final results on April 22, 2025, recommending 1,009 candidates for various services. Dongre, an engineering graduate from VIT, previously secured AIR 153 in 2023.

title: Pope Francis death: The curious connection between World Wars and papal deaths
content: But here’s the thing: timing is not causality. The idea that papal deaths somehow signal or foreshadow world wars is compelling as a narrative—especially in a social media age where historical trivia morphs easily into eschatological prophecy. But it falls into a classic logical trap: post hoc ergo propter hoc—after this, therefore because of this.

title: 'KL Rahul to replace Rishabh Pant in 2026 T20 World Cup'
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts changes for India's 2026 T20 World Cup team. KL Rahul may replace Rishabh Pant. Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill could step in for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Shreyas Iyer might replace Shivam Dube. Vipraj Nigam is a long-term prospect for Ravindra Jadeja. Mayank Yadav could partner with Arshdeep Singh.

title: Shocking! Rs 27 crore buy Rishabh Pant achieves another low for LSG
content: In a surprising move, Rishabh Pant batted at No. 7 for Delhi Capitals against Lucknow Super Giants, a rare occurrence after 113 IPL innings. Unfortunately, he was dismissed for a golden duck by Mukesh Kumar, who starred with 3 for 34. Pant’s struggles with the bat have been a recurring concern this season.

title: 'Unacceptable': SC Bar Association condemns BJP's Dubey's 'civil war' remark
content: The Supreme Court Bar Association (SCBA) has strongly condemned BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's remarks criticizing the Supreme Court and CJI Sanjiv Khanna regarding the Waqf law. The SCBA seeks contempt proceedings against Dubey, urging the Attorney General's consent. The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea for contempt, addressing Dubey's accusations of judicial overreach and undermining constitutional structures.

title: Pahalgam attack: 24/7 emergency helpline launched- what we know so far
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, J&K, which claimed 26 lives, authorities have launched a 24/7 emergency helpline for tourists. Union home minister Amit Shah and CM Omar Abdullah are en route to assess the situation. PM Modi, currently in Saudi Arabia, condemned the attack and assured justice, instructing Shah to take necessary actions.

title: 'Blinded by lights': Man files case against himself after daughter dies in accident
content: In a rare turn of events, Pappu Yogi filed a police complaint against himself after a tragic accident near Prantij toll plaza claimed the life of his eight-year-old daughter, Priyanka. Yogi, while driving his family from Mumbai to their village in Rajasthan, lost control of the car due to blinding lights, resulting in the fatal incident.

title: Why did revenue officials visit Usha Vance’s 96-year-old grandmother in Vizag?
content: The visit of US Vice-President J.D. Vance and Second Lady Usha Vance to India sparked emotional responses in Andhra Pradesh, where Usha’s ancestral roots lie. Her traditional gestures and family ties stirred local pride, prompting official inquiries and heartfelt appeals from relatives and villagers hoping for a visit. Usha’s lineage traces back to Andhra’s scholarly Chilukuri family.

title: Meet Harshita Goyal: Second highest scorer of UPSC 2024
content: Harshita Goyal, securing All India Rank 2 in the UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024, exemplifies dedication and a desire to serve. A Chartered Accountant from MS University of Baroda, she aims to impact grassroots levels, drawing from her involvement with the Gujarat Youth Parliament and the Believe Foundation. Her focus includes women's empowerment, envisioning equal access to opportunities.

title: Kash Patel's frequent use of govt jets has tongues wagging about personal travel decisions
content: FBI Director Kash Patel has been under scrutiny for his frequent use of government planes for personal travel, including high-profile sporting events and trips to his girlfriend's hometown. The timing and nature of these trips raise questions about the balance between professional duty and personal convenience. Critics argue that the government's air travel policy, which requires employees to pay the government back at a lower rate than private planes, may not be being used wisely.

title: From Shraddha Walkar to Saurabh Rajput: Why Indian couples are killing each other
content: A disturbing trend of intimate-partner homicides in India reveals a deadly mix of patriarchy, financial strain, infidelity, substance abuse, and mental health issues. Legal delays and societal norms exacerbate the problem, trapping victims and enabling perpetrators. Urgent systemic change, gender-neutral laws, and accessible counseling are crucial to address this silent epidemic and protect vulnerable individuals.

title: Former cricketer questions BCCI's double standards in Kohli case
content: Aakash Chopra has questioned the BCCI's apparent double standard, pointing out that Virat Kohli escaped punishment for his aggressive celebration directed at Shreyas Iyer, while Digvesh Rathi was fined twice for his notebook celebration. Chopra also recalled MS Dhoni being fined for arguing with umpires, suggesting Kohli received preferential treatment.

title: 'Spreading misinformation ... ' EC slams Rahul's claims on Maha polls
content: The Election Commission refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of abnormal voter turnout in the final hours of the Maharashtra assembly elections, deeming his allegations against the electoral rolls an affront to the rule of law. EC sources emphasized that Congress representatives didn't raise concerns during scrutiny.

title: Trump impact: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast to 6.2%
content: The IMF's April 2025 World Economic Outlook revised India's 2025 GDP growth to 6.2%, down from the previously projected 6.5%, due to increased trade tensions and global uncertainty stemming from US tariff policies.

title: Watch: Saudi singer welcomes PM Modi to Jeddah with 'Ae Watan' song
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a grand welcome in Jeddah, marked by a soulful rendition of 'Ae Watan' by a Saudi singer and a Royal Saudi Air Force escort. A 21-gun salute further underscored the visit's importance.

title: Why Trump wants to fire Pete Hegseth
content: If the first leak was a lapse, the second looks like a pattern. And patterns — especially those that risk lives — are rarely tolerated long in Washington, even in a Trump-led administration where loyalty often trumps protocol.

title: Tightest title races: Serie A playoff? 6 potential champions?
content: a lot of titles are already a foregone conclusion in most countries in Europe . there are also a few leagues across Europe, and even elsewhere in England . the most high-profile title race that is reaching boiling point is Italy's Serie A .

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Hurricanes new favorites following Avalanche Game 2 loss
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs have begun with 16 teams looking to be the last one standing after four rounds of playoff hockey . the Toronto Maple Leafs will look to snap the longest championship drought in NHL history . they will have to contend with their cross-state rivals, the Ottawa Senators .

title: NBA playoff odds; Thunder, Celtics heavily favored to play for NBA championship
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds than the second-seed Houston Rockets . despite their game 1 win, the Timberwolves are still well behind the lakers in the odds .

title: Ranking the top 10 defensive backs in college football
content: Ohio State's Caleb Downs is the best defensive back in college football in 2025 . he was targeted 14 times last season and allowed 2.1 yards per attempt . our college football reporters were asked to select the top 10 defensive backs .

title: 'If a hot girl texts you ... ': Musk mocks crypto scams in viral X post
content: Elon Musk cautioned against cryptocurrency scams on X with a viral image, highlighting scammers' use of fake profiles, often posing as attractive women, to lure victims. The post underscores that these messages, despite appearances, are frequently sent by male scammers. Musk's warning addresses the serious issue of crypto-related fraud on social media, where scammers exploit users for financial gain.

title: Man who told Bengaluru driver to 'speak Hindi' apologises in Kannada
content: A video showing a man demanding an auto driver speak Hindi in Bengaluru sparked a language debate. The man, dubbed the 'Hindi warrior,' later apologized in Kannada, claiming he didn't intend to offend and regretted his outburst.

title: 'Our kids just like him, food was too good': Vance on visit to PM Modi's home
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited Prime Minister Narendra Modi's residence in New Delhi. Vance shared his positive experience, highlighting the Prime Minister's hospitality and its impact on his children, with his eldest son even expressing a desire to live in India.

title: Australia reacts to reports of banning visa of Indians from 'specific states'
content: Australia has refuted claims that it's restricting student visa applications from Indian states like Punjab and Gujarat. The Australian High Commission in New Delhi clarified that no such ban exists, emphasizing the strong educational ties between the two nations. Over 125,000 Indian students are currently studying in Australia, highlighting their significant contribution.
